intro: Calandrinia poeppigiana, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its succulent leaves and showy blooms make it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Calandrinia poeppigiana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
